Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
At Bi-Rite, several sustainable and environmental practices have been implemented to reduce their environmental impact. Some of these practices include:

1. Zero Waste Goal: Bi-Rite is committed to becoming a zero-waste company, having already achieved a 7% diversion rate from landfills through recycling and composting.
2. Energy Efficiency: By switching to LED lighting, Bi-Rite estimates they will save approximately 63 kilowatts of electricity per year.
3. Sustainable Product & Material Management: Bi-Rite currently reuses or recycles 85 products and materials, demonstrating their dedication to reducing waste.
4. Supporting Local Farmers: Bi-Rite sources ingredients from local farmers who prioritize sustainable practices, such as organic farmer Javier Zamora of JSM Organics.
5. Environmentally Conscious Procurement: Bi-Rite goes beyond certifications to understand how their products are grown and made, ensuring they support responsible agricultural practices.
6. Continuous Improvement: Bi-Rite actively seeks opportunities to enhance their sustainability efforts, such as finding more direct routes to source high-quality products and regularly evaluating their product selection.

These initiatives demonstrate Bi-Rite's commitment to minimizing their environmental impact and contributing to a more sustainable future.

source.content: Our beautiful planet is a key member of the Bi-Rite community and we have immense respect for the hard work it takes to grow raise and craft good food All of which is why we’re on a path to be a Zero Waste company reusing or recycling 90 of our products and materials Delicious but not beautiful fruit and produce that guests don’t want to buy can always be used in other ways In fact Bi-Rite Creamery created two ice cream flavors for just that purpose Our famous Balsamic Strawberry and Roasted Banana ice creams use the fruit that would otherwise end up composted to bring smiles and joy to our guests The chefs in our Markets’ kitchens turn our imperfect produce into delicious creative dinners every night They can use remaining pieces from the butcher for staff meal Broken cookies can be turned into sundae toppings Sure it takes commitment and a little extra time to figure out what to do with this food that would otherwise go to waste but being sustainable feels good and tastes delicious

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Yes, there are several events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation. Here are ten examples from the given context:

1. The Women's Building food pantry (providing free food to Mission community members)
2. Bi-Rite's first holiday season at their new location (feeding families during the holidays)
3. A national organization working to increase power in marginalized communities (increasing access to voting, policy advocacy, and infrastructure development)
4. Youth-run supper club in the Bayview (championing success while promoting sustainability)
5. Community center in low-income housing (supporting youth development and environmentally conscious programs)
6. Weekly food pantry at a women-led community space (reducing food waste and providing nutritional support to the local community)
7. Zero Waste company encouraging clients and guests to minimize waste (promoting eco-friendly practices)
8. Holiday meal kit donations to families in need (providing fresh, locally sourced ingredients)
9. Planting trees in the Bayview district (enhancing the urban forest and supporting biodiversity)
10. Various community-centered programs focusing on environmental stewardship

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
From the provided text, it appears that several environmental impact metrics are reported. These include:

1. Waste diversion: Bi-Rite reports diverting "more than  pounds of waste from the landfill by recycling and composting." This metric indicates the amount of waste that has been kept out of landfills due to recycling and composting efforts.
2. Energy savings: Bi-Rite also reports saving an estimated "63 kilowatts per year" by switching to LED lights. This metric shows the reduction in energy consumption and associated carbon emissions resulting from the lighting upgrade.
3. Reused/recycled materials: Bi-Rite mentions that they reuse or recycle "79 of our products and materials," providing insight into the extent of their material conservation efforts.

These metrics help Bi-Rite track its progress towards sustainability goals and demonstrate its commitment to reducing its environmental impact.

It’s valuable to have firsthand understanding of our agricultural system and the environmental impact of growing food on any scale To appreciate the labor and commitment it takes and to be familiar with the complexities our farmers and ranchers face to provide sustainable responsible food Which is why in  Bi-Rite started our own farm in Sonoma The original half-acre parcel grew to a three-acre farm where more than 50 different crop varietals were grown every year We farmed using “beyond organic” sustainable farming practices which means we could be outside the umbrella of certification but still have the confidence of knowing exactly what’s in our produce We’ve learned a lot through the past 13 years including how drought soil erosion and other environmental impacts can make once bountiful farmland infertile So while our vertically integrated Sonoma farm is no longer viable our quest to understand the land and our changing world increases We’re actively looking for new farmland in a

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, the Bi-Rite Family of Businesses has made several public commitments to social and corporate responsibility. Firstly, they are a Certified B Corporation, which means they adhere to high social and environmental standards. Additionally, they strive to become a zero-waste company by reusing or recycling 9% of their products and materials. Furthermore, they prioritize sourcing products responsibly, understanding the full cost of production, and ensuring fair compensation for their vendors. Lastly, they engage in various initiatives within their local community, such as supporting small farms and reducing food waste.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Are there annual or quarterly reports detailing these commitments? If yes, then summarize.
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, there are annual or quarterly reports detailing the Bi-Rite Family of Businesses' commitments related to social and environmental responsibility. These reports provide updates on their efforts towards becoming a more sustainable and socially responsible organization. They cover various aspects such as sourcing practices, waste reduction initiatives, employee welfare, and community engagement programs. By sharing these reports, Bi-Rite demonstrates its dedication to transparency and continuous improvement.

This  holiday season  families in the Western Addition received a box brimming with the makings of a fresh healthy holiday meal And it all happens thanks to the care and commitment of Collective Impact the neighborhood-based nonprofit behind the Mo’MAGIC Holiday Food Box program “Sitting down at the table together is really important – it keeps families healthy and connected That’s why we put so much effort into our Western Addition food boxes each year” says Mo’MAGIC’s executive director Brittany Ford “For families living in SROs and low-income housing units these boxes are a wonderful reason – and way – to celebrate together” Since the Holiday Food Box program is a vital way for Mo’MAGIC to address the lack of access the hundreds of families living in SROs and public housing units have to turkeys and fresh organic produce during the holidays logistical planning for the annual homegrown program starts each spring Volunteers are identified partners are confirmed and together the

rerouting children to avoid traumatic situations and contributing to a culture of safety in the Tenderloin We can’t wait to get out there and meet more of our neighbors – Tim Ross Bi-Rite Cafe How is volunteering in step with Bi-Rite’s mission of Creating Community Through Food Our passion for community building thrives through service to local organizations Our staff live in the very communities we aim to serve and volunteering is a way for employees to further experience how their work has a direct impact We’re drawn to the mission of Creating Community Through Food and we try to find small and large ways to fulfill that mission every day – Sierra Hawthorne Bi-Rite Market Divisadero Click to learn more about The Women’s Building Mo’Magic Friends of the Urban Forest  Tenderloin Safe Passage Be the first to know what's new in Good Food

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result: Bi-Rite offers a range of products and services through its platform. These include ordering food items to pick up in-store or have them shipped or delivered, catering services, and online shopping for groceries and specialty items. Additionally, they utilize cookies, pixels, and other tracking technologies to collect information about users and improve their overall experience on the website or mobile app.

Commerce & Products.question: Are there any promotional events, expos, or sales for these offerings? If yes, list them.
Commerce & Products.result:
Yes, there are various promotional events, expos, and sales related to these offerings. Here's a summary of some notable ones:

* Bi-Rite Catering: From time to time, they host exclusive events featuring their catering services. These events often include tastings, demonstrations, and special promotions. Keep an eye out for announcements regarding upcoming events on their website and social media channels.
* Reem's Arab Bakery: Occasionally, Reem's participates in community events, farmers markets, and food festivals where they showcase their products and offer special deals or promotions. Following their social media accounts (Facebook, Twitter, etc.) will keep you informed about their appearances and promotions.
* Zap

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result: One significant collaboration related to commerce at Bi-Rite is their direct relationship with local independent suppliers. They aim to source at least 6% of their products from these suppliers, providing them with opportunities to grow and thrive. Additionally, Bi-Rite values under-represented suppliers, emphasizing inclusivity and support for diverse communities within the food industry. This approach fosters mutual benefit between Bi-Rite and its suppliers, ultimately contributing to a stronger local food economy.

source.content: In the ever-evolving food landscape we make educated decisions and push the boundaries of responsible sourcing We’re committed to sourcing at least 60 of our products from local independent suppliers And we’re committed to lending them a hand to help them succeed whether it’s through coaching and training favorable terms or simply being the first retailer to offer them a space on the shelf When evaluating multiple supplier options we give preference to under-represented suppliers those who demonstrate a commitment to reducing their environmental impact and those which contribute to economic empowerment Suppliers are expected to adhere to Bi-Rite’s supplier code of conduct We also inform our community about the true cost of food and actively advocate a positive impact on our food system By celebrating craft and heritage we preserve diversity traditions and taste As a result our food is honest memorable and full of flavor Our relationships are as direct as possible and always mutually

new markets land and capital to thought partnership and skill-building “Human beings take part in every step of getting food to our plates but they’re often invisible Helping farmers feel ‘seen’ is a huge part of what our work is about” says Pei-Yee Woo Kitchen Table Advisors’ Associate Director “Feeding people is one of the strongest most intimate acts of community and our farmers and ranchers are doing it on an incredible regional scale How can we show our gratitude What can we do for them What does it mean for our farmers to be taken care of in return” We believe the answer is making connections Between the deliciousness on your plate and the passion of the producers Between the choices in your cart and the impact those choices can have on your community The decisions we make as businesses and as individuals – even a small decision like where to buy strawberries – can transform people’s lives Says Daniella Sawaya KTA’s Community Engagement Manager “A recent graduate of our program

in the Markets Just ask Bi-Rite’s butcher team focuses on building relationships directly with ranchers who are committed to humane animal husbandry practices and land stewardship The result is that our products simply taste better Under the guidance of category manager Chili Montes our butchers practice whole animal butchery and use every part in thoughtful delicious ways from the staple butcher cuts to our pre-packaged marinated meats Custom orders and custom cuts are always welcome Our seafood focuses on seasonality sustainability and transparency We love to celebrate seasonal Pacific Coast fisheries from Alaska to Mexico And the aquaculture programs we work with use advancements in feed development and water management to minimize their impact on the environment We’re a Market led by Chefs We’re inspired by not only the season’s bounty but by what arrives fresh every morning and love turning that food into delicious meals for you every day From the offerings in our deli case to

small entrepreneurs’ craftsmanship social and environmental responsibility throughout our quest to build a sustainable good food community At our Creamery and Bakeshop everything we make is made by hand in small batches from our daily-churned ice creams to our freshly baked cookies We keep things simple because we want our incredible ingredients to shine Owner Kris Hoogerhyde executive pastry chef JP and their team are incredibly selective about where those ingredients come from prioritizing flavor sustainability and seasonality Every day in the Markets you’ll find pints of Bi-Rite Creamery ice cream – from the everyday favorites like Salted Caramel to the seasonal must-haves like Peach Cobbler and Eggnog There’s also a wide offering of baked goods like our brownies and Joy of Almond cookies that highlight our bakers’ skills at crafting perfectly balanced sweets Our most frequently photographed department Bi-Rite’s Floral selection was voted “Best Floral Shop” by SF Weekly in  Floral

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Yes, there are various events happening throughout the year related to job fairs, webinars, workshops, and training programs. Here's a list of some notable events from the mentioned categories:

Job Fairs:

* Annual Career Expo (hosted by SFUSD): Held in March, this event brings together representatives from various schools, nonprofit organizations, government agencies, and businesses to connect with potential candidates for jobs and internships.
* Tech Job Fair (hosted by TechSF): Occurring multiple times throughout the year, this fair offers opportunities to explore careers in technology and meet with representatives from top tech companies based in San Francisco.

Webinars/Online Workshops:

* LinkedIn Learning Webinars: Regularly scheduled online sessions covering a wide range of topics, including career development, personal finance, and software skills. These webinars are free and open to anyone with a LinkedIn account.
* Coursera & edX Online Courses: Both platforms offer a variety of courses and certifications in various fields, such as data science, project management, and digital marketing. Many courses are offered for free or at a reduced rate for auditing.

Workshops/Training Programs:

* Small Business Development Center (SBDC) Workshops: Hosted by the SBDC, these workshops cover essential topics for entrepreneurs and small business owners, such as financial management, marketing strategies, and business planning.
* Youth Employment Services (YES) Training Programs: YES provides young people aged 14 with job readiness training, paid internships, and post-internship support services. Their programs focus on developing essential skills for the workforce.

The Bi-Rite Family of Businesses is proud to be a Certified B Corporation which means we’re part of a movement using the power of business to solve social and economic problems B Corps are publicly and transparently accountable to consider the impact of our decisions on our staff guests suppliers community and the environment The certification process includes a + question assessment and a rigorous 15-month verification process Recertification involves additional scrutiny to meet updated standards and demonstrate ongoing progress in the five impact areas Originally certified in  with a score of  Bi-Rite was recertified in  with a  and again in  earning a  We’ve also been recognized among the top 5 worldwide Best for the World in the Community impact category since  We’re committed to continuing this work – to improving our social impact and using Bi-Rite as a force for good in the world We’d love to have you join us on this journey Today there are more than 6 Certified B Corporations

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What organizations, institutions, or entities is the organization collaborating with?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Bi-Rite is collaborating with several organizations, institutions, and entities to achieve its social impact goals. Some of these partners include:

1. Tenderloin Safe Passage: A community-based organization focused on ensuring the safety and wellbeing of children in the Tenderloin neighborhood. They work closely with local residents, schools, and nonprofits to provide support and resources.
2. National organization (name not provided): A national organization aimed at empowering marginalized communities by providing access to voting rights, policy advocacy, and infrastructure development. Their mission aligns with Bi-Rite's commitment to social impact and community engagement.
3. Youth-run supper club: A unique initiative that provides young people with hands-on experience in the culinary industry, as well as valuable skills in leadership, teamwork, and communication. By supporting this project, Bi-Rite is investing in the future leaders of the Bay Area's food scene.
4. Community center: An organization dedicated to fostering personal growth and opportunity for underprivileged youth living in low-income housing. Through mentorship, youth development programs, and essential services like food assistance, they strive to break cycles of poverty and inequality.
5. Women-led community space: A feminist hub that promotes self-determination, gender equity, and social justice. In addition to hosting events and workshops, they operate a weekly food pantry that serves the Mission community, demonstrating Bi-Rite's commitment to addressing food insecurity in the area.

source.content: The Bi-Rite Family of Businesses is proud to be a Certified B Corporation which means we’re part of a movement using the power of business to solve social and economic problems B Corps are publicly and transparently accountable to consider the impact of our decisions on our staff guests suppliers community and the environment The certification process includes a + question assessment and a rigorous 15-month verification process Recertification involves additional scrutiny to meet updated standards and demonstrate ongoing progress in the five impact areas Originally certified in  with a score of  Bi-Rite was recertified in  with a  and again in  earning a  We’ve also been recognized among the top 5 worldwide Best for the World in the Community impact category since  We’re committed to continuing this work – to improving our social impact and using Bi-Rite as a force for good in the world We’d love to have you join us on this journey Today there are more than 6 Certified B Corporations

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: Are there any joint events, projects, or initiatives? If yes then list them.
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Yes, there are several joint events, projects, and initiatives between the mentioned organizations. Some examples include:

1. Bi-Rite Market & Women's Building Food Pantry: Bi-Rite Market supports the Women's Building Food Pantry by providing fresh produce and other items for distribution to those in need. Staff from Bi-Rite Market regularly volunteer at the pantry.
2. Bi-Rite Market & Mo'Magic Healthy Holiday Meal Box Program: For the past three years, Rachel Gray from Bi-Rite Catering has volunteered at Mo'Magic's annual healthy holiday meal box program. Bi-Rite Market contributes to the project by providing ingredients and resources.
3. Bi-Rite Market & Friends of the Urban Forest Tree Planting: Bi-Rite Market participates in tree planting events organized by Friends of the Urban Forest. Staff from Bi-Rite Market volunteer their time to help plant trees in various locations around San Francisco.
4. Bi-Rite Market & Tenderloin Safe Passage Community Safety Initiative: Tim Ross from Bi-Rite Cafe is excited to work with Tenderloin Safe Passage, an organization that focuses on keeping children safe in the Tenderloin neighborhood. Bi-Rite Market may contribute to the cause by hosting fundraising events or promoting awareness about the initiative.
5. Bi-Rite Catering & One-Of-A-Kind Youth-Run Supper Club: While not explicitly stated, it seems possible that Bi-Rite Catering could provide catering services for special events or gatherings held at the youth-run supper club. This collaboration would enable both parties to benefit from the partnership, as Bi-Rite Catering could showcase its culinary expertise while supporting the mission of the supper club.

Each month the Bi-Rite Family of Businesses shines a spotlight on local nonprofits that are directly serving those in need in our neighborhoods This December members of our staff who are especially committed to extending our community impact selected four partner programs to highlight The Women’s Building Food Pantry Mo’Magic healthy holiday meal box program Friends of the Urban Forest tree planting and Tenderloin Safe Passage’s community safety initiative And in the spirit of the season staff will be volunteering at each partner program throughout the month and helping collect donations for the organizations in the Markets We sat down with our staff to learn more about these partners and why they’re excited to give back this holiday season In addition to financially supporting these community partners this season staff across the Bi-Rite Family of Businesses are also volunteering Why do you think that’s especially meaningful A significant reason we’re able to support these partners –

it’s important that we see them that we serve them that we help give them the tools to create resilience – Moira Chase Bi-Rite Market 18th Street This will be Bi-Rite’s first holiday season at our new location in Civic Center Plaza what are you looking forward to about volunteering in this neighborhood The Tenderloin and Civic Center neighborhoods are some of the most unique and diverse areas of San Francisco We’re excited to work with Tenderloin Safe Passage an organization that is truly an integral part of the fabric of the Tenderloin neighborhood It’s so amazing that Safe Passage a program started by a group of mothers who came together to find a new way to keep their children safe has grown into this coalition of community members working to respond to different emergencies while rerouting children to avoid traumatic situations and contributing to a culture of safety in the Tenderloin We can’t wait to get out there and meet more of our neighbors – Tim Ross Bi-Rite Cafe How is

partners this season staff across the Bi-Rite Family of Businesses are also volunteering Why do you think that’s especially meaningful A significant reason we’re able to support these partners – and to take time to volunteer –  is because of our guests They make a conscious decision to support a company that values community every time they shop with us or order catering Volunteering is an opportunity for us to increase our impact to spend time together as a company and bond in our shared passion for helping others – Rachel Gray Bi-Rite Catering You’ve volunteered at Mo’Magic for the past three years what’s your experience been like   This program is amazing It’s Bi-Rite’s seventh year collaborating with Mo’Magic some of our producers other San Francisco companies and the local police department to put together holiday meal kits full of seasonal produce and sustainably raised turkeys to give to  families in need in the Western Addition It is incredibly empowering for me to be a part

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations involve fostering community, promoting sustainability, and supporting local businesses. By gathering around a table together, Bi-Rite hopes to create connections between people, food, and the land. This leads to stronger community bonds and a deeper understanding of the food system. Additionally, Bi-Rite strives to work with partners who share their commitment to sustainability and ethical practices. These partnerships help promote responsible agriculture, fair labor practices, and environmental stewardship. Ultimately, the goal of these collaborations is to create a thriving, sustainable food community that benefits all members, including customers, producers, and the planet.

source.content: Something powerful happens when we gather around a table together We become connected to each other to the food on the table to the producers who grew raised and crafted the delicious food and connected to the land where it came from Gathering around a table together creates community On a mission of Creating Community Through Food Bi-Rite strives every day to cultivate meaningful relationships with each member at our proverbial table We believe it’s our responsibility to cultivate an organization that helps our community – you our guests our producers and partners our staff and our planet – thrive for generations to come That might sound overly ambitious But with community values of Lead with LOVE Pursue with PASSION and Act with INTEGRITY we’re up for the challenge We hope you’ll join us on the journey to build a sustaining vibrant food community Under the leadership of second-generation owner Sam Mogannam since  the Bi-Rite Family of Businesses has grown to include two

incomparable working conditions schooling for children access to healthcare and to invest in projects to improve their communities such as student transportation and health clinics In  Javier Zamora started JSM Organics named after his mother Javier Sanchez Medina with a trailer and small acre and a half of land through a lease subsidized by the Agriculture and Land Based Training Association Today he’s expanded to more than  acres Known for being innovative and compassionate Javier is an incredible partner of ours truly embodying our values of love passion and integrity And the delicious organic berries he grows are something we anxiously await every berry season Dick Peixoto and his brother began farming green beans while in high school Today Dick personally walks the fields of his certified organic farm every day to check on their 50 different varietals which includes broccoli carrots cauliflower chicories lettuces and peppers many of which are featured in our salads and side

We go beyond certifications to understand how our products were grown and made We respond and adapt to the changes in our environment and to new issues facing the food system We aren’t satisfied with the status quo and are always looking for areas where we can improve and inspire and assist others on their path to greater sustainability We are constantly learning and advancing such as finding even more direct routes to amazing products like our single-farm source Parmigiano Reggiano to evaluating our product selection weeding out legacy items and replacing them with those that meet or exceed our standards We understand that there are many external costs involved in creating the outstanding products we sell and we aim to ensure that these are fully reflected in the prices our vendors receive for their goods We know that when something seems to be a value it can mean that environmental human or other factors were not accounted for and that cheap food is paid for in other ways We pay a
